pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena therā bhikkhū bhikkhuniyo ovadanti pariyāyena. Tena kho pana samayena āyasmato cūḷapanthakassa pariyāyo hoti bhikkhuniyo ovadituṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.2.eng: the senior monks were taking turns instructing the nuns. Then, on one occasion, it was Venerable Cūḷapanthaka’s turn.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.3.pli: Bhikkhuniyo evamāhaṃsu—“na dāni ajja ovādo iddho bhavissati, taññeva dāni udānaṃ ayyo cūḷapanthako punappunaṃ bhaṇissatī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.3.eng: The nuns said, “Today the instruction won’t be effective. Venerable Cūḷapanthaka will just be repeating the same thing over and over.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.4.pli: Atha kho tā bhikkhuniyo yenāyasmā cūḷapanthako tenupasaṅkamiṃsu; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ cūḷapanthakaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdiṃsu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.4.eng: Soon afterwards those nuns went to Cūḷapanthaka, bowed, and sat down.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.5.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinnā kho tā bhikkhuniyo āyasmā cūḷapanthako etadavoca—“samaggāttha, bhaginiyo”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.5.eng: Cūḷapanthaka then said to them, “Are you all here, Sisters?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.5.comm: “Are you all here” renders samaggāttha, literally, “are you united”. Sp 2.149: Samaggātthāti sabbā āgatatthāti attho, “Are you united: the meaning is ‘Have you all come?’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.7.eng: “Are you keeping the eight important principles?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.9.pli: “Eso, bhaginiyo, ovādo”ti niyyādetvā imaṃ udānaṃ punappunaṃ abhāsi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.9.eng: After saying, “This is the instruction,” he uttered the same heartfelt exclamation again and again:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.10.eng: “For the heedful one possessed of the higher mind,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.11.eng: For the sage training on the path to sagacity—

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.12.eng: There are no sorrows for such a one,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.13.eng: The peaceful one, who is always mindful.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.14.pli: Bhikkhuniyo evamāhaṃsu—“nanu avocumhā—na dāni ajja ovādo iddho bhavissati, taññeva dāni udānaṃ ayyo cūḷapanthako punappunaṃ bhaṇissatī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.14.eng: And the nuns said, “Didn’t we say that the instruction wouldn’t be effective, that Venerable Cūḷapanthaka would just be repeating the same thing over and over?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.15.pli: Assosi kho āyasmā cūḷapanthako tāsaṃ bhikkhunīnaṃ imaṃ kathāsallāpaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.15.eng: Cūḷapanthaka overheard that conversation between the nuns.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.16.pli: Atha kho āyasmā cūḷapanthako vehāsaṃ abbhuggantvā ākāse antalikkhe caṅkamatipi tiṭṭhatipi nisīdatipi seyyampi kappeti dhūmāyatipi pajjalatipi antaradhāyatipi, tañceva udānaṃ bhaṇati aññañca bahuṃ buddhavacanaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.16.eng: He then rose up into the air, walked back and forth in space, and he stood, sat down, and lay down there. He emitted smoke and fire, and he disappeared, all the while uttering the same heartfelt exclamation and many other sayings by the Buddha.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.19.pli: Na vata no ito pubbe ovādo evaṃ iddho bhūtapubbo yathā ayyassa cūḷapanthakassā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.19.eng: No previous instruction has been as effective as this one from Venerable Cūḷapanthaka!”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.20.pli: Atha kho āyasmā cūḷapanthako tā bhikkhuniyo yāva samandhakārā ovaditvā uyyojesi—“gacchatha, bhaginiyo”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.20.eng: And Cūḷapanthaka kept on instructing those nuns until the dark of night and then dismissed them, saying, “Go, Sisters.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.21.pli: Atha kho tā bhikkhuniyo nagaradvāre thakite bahinagare vasitvā kālasseva nagaraṃ pavisanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.21.eng: But because the gates to town were closed, those nuns spent the night outside and only entered early in the morning.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.22.pli: Manussā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—“abrahmacāriniyo imā bhikkhuniyo;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.22.eng: People complained and criticized them, “These nuns aren’t celibate.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.23.pli: ārāme bhikkhūhi saddhiṃ vasitvā idāni nagaraṃ pavisantī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.23.eng: They spend the night in the monastery with the monks and only now do they enter town.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.24.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhū tesaṃ manussānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.24.eng: The monks heard the complaints of those people,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.25.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.25.eng: and the monks of few desires complained and criticized Cūḷapanthaka,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.26.pli: “kathañhi nāma āyasmā cūḷapanthako atthaṅgate sūriye bhikkhuniyo ovadissatī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.26.eng: “How could Venerable Cūḷapanthaka instruct the nuns after the sun has set?”…

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.27.pli: “saccaṃ kira tvaṃ, cūḷapanthaka, atthaṅgate sūriye bhikkhuniyo ovadasī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.27.eng: “Is it true, Cūḷapanthaka, that you did this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.30.pli: kathañhi nāma tvaṃ, cūḷapanthaka, atthaṅgate sūriye bhikkhuniyo ovadissasi.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.32.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.32.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.33.1.pli: “Sammatopi ce bhikkhu atthaṅgate sūriye bhikkhuniyo ovadeyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:1.33.1.eng: ‘Even if he has been appointed, if a monk instructs the nuns after sunset, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:2.1.2.eng: has been appointed through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:2.1.4.eng: after the sun has gone down.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:2.1.6.eng: they have been given the full ordination by both Sanghas.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:2.1.8.pli: aṭṭhahi vā garudhammehi aññena vā dhammena ovadati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:2.1.8.eng: if he instructs in the eight important principles or he gives any other teaching, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:2.2.1.eng: If the sun has set, and he perceives that it has, and he instructs the nuns, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:2.2.2.eng: If the sun has set, but he is unsure of it, and he instructs the nuns, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:2.2.3.eng: If the sun has set, but he perceives that it has not, and he instructs the nuns, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:2.2.4.eng: If he instructs a nun who is fully ordained only on one side, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:2.2.5.eng: If the sun has not set, but he perceives that it has, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:2.2.6.eng: If the sun has not set, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:2.2.7.eng: If the sun has not set, and he perceives that it has not, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:2.3.4.eng: if he recites when asked to do so;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:2.3.4.comm: That osāreti must mean “recite” can be seen from Bu Pc 4:2.3.5 where there is no offense if osārentaṁ opāteti, “he prompts one who is osārentaṁ.” The difference between uddesaṁ deti and osāreti is not clear to me.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:2.3.6.eng: if he replies when asked a question;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:2.3.7.eng: if he is speaking for the benefit of someone else and the nuns listen in;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:2.3.8.eng: if it is to a trainee nun;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:2.3.9.eng: if it is to a novice nun;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:2.3.11.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc22:2.3.12.eng: The training rule on set, the second, is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:0.5.eng: 23. The training rule on the nuns’ dwelling place

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sakkesu viharati kapilavatthusmiṃ nigrodhārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying in the Sakyan country in the Banyan Tree Monastery at Kapilavatthu,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū bhikkhunupassayaṃ upasaṅkamitvā chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo ovadanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:1.2.eng: the monks from the group of six went to the nuns’ dwelling place and instructed the nuns from the group of six.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:1.2.comm: “Nunnery” renders upassaya. According to the word definition below, this includes any place where a nun stays. In other words, it spans anything from a single hut, see Bi Pc 35, to a monastery. The Jain text The Ācārāṅga-sūtra, contains a passage that describes an upassaya as including a grassy area, that is, it must have been a compound of buildings or a monastery: “A layman might, for the sake of a mendicant ... cutting and clipping the grass outside or within the upāśraya (= upassaya).” See Jacobi, Hermann, trans. “Jaina Sutras Part I”. Motilal Babarsidass, 1964, p. 94.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:1.3.eng: Soon afterwards, other nuns said to the nuns from the group of six,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:1.4.eng: “Come, venerables, let’s go to the instruction.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:1.5.pli: “Yampi mayaṃ, ayye, gaccheyyāma ovādassa kāraṇā, ayyā chabbaggiyā idheva āgantvā amhe ovadantī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:1.5.eng: “There’s no need. The monks from the group of six came and instructed us right here.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:1.6.eng: The nuns complained and criticized the monks from the group of six,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:1.7.pli: “kathañhi nāma chabbaggiyā bhikkhū bhikkhunupassayaṃ upasaṅkamitvā bhikkhuniyo ovadissantī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:1.7.eng: “How could the monks from the group of six go and instruct the nuns at their dwelling place?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:1.8.pli: Atha kho tā bhikkhuniyo bhikkhūnaṃ etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:1.8.eng: Then those nuns told the monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:1.9.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:1.9.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized those monks,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:1.10.pli: “kathañhi nāma chabbaggiyā bhikkhū bhikkhunupassayaṃ upasaṅkamitvā bhikkhuniyo ovadissantī”ti …pe…

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:1.11.pli: “saccaṃ kira tumhe, bhikkhave, bhikkhunupassayaṃ upasaṅkamitvā bhikkhuniyo ovadathā”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:1.11.eng: “Is it true, monks, that you did this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:1.14.pli: kathañhi nāma tumhe, moghapurisā, bhikkhunupassayaṃ upasaṅkamitvā bhikkhuniyo ovadissatha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:1.14.eng: “Foolish men, how could you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:1.16.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:1.16.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:1.17.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhunupassayaṃ upasaṅkamitvā bhikkhuniyo ovadeyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:1.17.1.eng: ‘If a monk goes to the nuns’ dwelling place, and then instructs them, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:1.18.pli: Evañcidaṃ bhagavatā bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:1.18.eng: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena mahāpajāpati gotamī gilānā hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:2.1.eng: Soon afterwards Mahāpajāpati Gotamī became sick.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:2.2.pli: Therā bhikkhū yena mahāpajāpati gotamī tenupasaṅkamiṃsu;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:2.2.eng: The senior monks went to see her

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:2.4.eng: “We hope you’re bearing up, Gotamī, we hope you’re getting better?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:2.5.eng: “I’m not bearing up, venerables, and I’m not getting better.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:2.7.pli: “Na, bhagini, kappati bhikkhunupassayaṃ upasaṅkamitvā bhikkhuniyo dhammaṃ desetun”ti kukkuccāyantā na desesuṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:2.7.eng: “It’s not allowable for us to go and teach the nuns at their dwelling place.” And being afraid of wrongdoing, they did not teach her.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:2.8.pli: Atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayaṃ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya yena mahāpajāpati gotamī tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:2.8.eng: Soon afterwards, after robing up in the morning, the Buddha took his bowl and robe and went to Mahāpajāpati Gotamī where he sat down on the prepared seat.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:2.9.pli: Nisajja kho bhagavā mahāpajāpatiṃ gotamiṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:2.10.eng: “I hope you’re bearing up, Gotamī, I hope you’re getting better?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:2.11.pli: “Pubbe me, bhante, therā bhikkhū āgantvā dhammaṃ desenti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:2.11.eng: “Previously, sir, the senior monks would come and teach me,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:2.12.eng: and because of that I would be comfortable.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:2.13.pli: Idāni pana—‘bhagavatā paṭikkhittan’ti, kukkuccāyantā na desenti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:2.13.eng: But now that this has been prohibited by the Buddha, they don’t teach because they’re afraid of wrongdoing.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:2.14.eng: Because of that I’m not comfortable.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:2.15.pli: Atha kho bhagavā mahāpajāpatiṃ gotamiṃ dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahaṃsetvā uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkāmi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:2.15.eng: After instructing, inspiring, and gladdening her with a teaching, the Buddha got up from his seat and left.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:2.16.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:2.16.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:2.17.pli: “anujānāmi, bhikkhave, bhikkhunupassayaṃ upasaṅkamitvā gilānaṃ bhikkhuniṃ ovadituṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:2.17.eng: “Monks, I allow you to go and instruct a sick nun at her dwelling place.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:2.18.pli: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:2.18.eng: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:2.19.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhunupassayaṃ upasaṅkamitvā bhikkhuniyo ovadeyya, aññatra samayā, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:2.19.1.eng: ‘If a monk goes to the nuns’ dwelling place and then instructs them, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:2.20.pli: Tatthāyaṃ samayo. Gilānā hoti bhikkhunī—ayaṃ tattha samayo”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:2.20.eng: This is the appropriate occasion: a nun is sick.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:3.1.4.eng: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:3.1.6.eng: wherever nuns stay, even for a single night.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:3.1.10.eng: she has been given the full ordination by both Sanghas.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:3.1.12.eng: if he instructs about the eight important principles, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:3.1.14.eng: unless it is an appropriate occasion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:3.1.16.pli: na sakkoti ovādāya vā saṃvāsāya vā gantuṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:3.1.16.eng: she is not able to go to the instruction or to a formal meeting of the community.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:3.1.16.comm: “A formal meeting of the community”, saṁvāsa, is defined at Bu Pc 69:2.1.21, as the observance-day ceremony, the invitation ceremony, or a legal procedure.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:3.2.1.pli: Upasampannāya upasampannasaññī bhikkhunupassayaṃ upasaṅkamitvā aññatra samayā ovadati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:3.2.1.eng: If she is fully ordained, and he perceives her as such, and he goes to her dwelling place and then instructs her, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:3.2.2.pli: Upasampannāya vematiko bhikkhunupassayaṃ upasaṅkamitvā aññatra samayā ovadati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:3.2.2.eng: If she is fully ordained, but he is unsure of it, and he goes to her dwelling place and then instructs her, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:3.2.3.pli: Upasampannāya anupasampannasaññī bhikkhunupassayaṃ upasaṅkamitvā aññatra samayā ovadati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:3.2.3.eng: If she is fully ordained, but he does not perceive her as such, and he goes to her dwelling place and then instructs her, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:3.2.4.eng: If he instructs her with another teaching, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:3.2.5.eng: If he instructs a nun who is fully ordained only on one side, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:3.2.6.eng: If she is not fully ordained, but he perceives her as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:3.2.7.eng: If she is not fully ordained, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:3.2.8.eng: If she is not fully ordained, and he does not perceive her as such, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:3.3.2.eng: if it is an appropriate occasion;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:3.3.5.eng: if he recites when asked to do so;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:3.3.5.comm: That osāreti must mean “recite” can be seen from Bu Pc 4:2.3.5 where there is no offense if osārentaṁ opāteti, “he prompts one who is osārentaṁ.” The difference between uddesaṁ deti and osāreti is not clear to me.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:3.3.7.eng: if he replies when asked a question;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:3.3.8.eng: if he is speaking for the benefit of someone else and the nuns listen in;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:3.3.9.eng: if it is to a trainee nun;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:3.3.10.eng: if it is to a novice nun;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:3.3.12.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:3.3.13.eng: The training rule on the nuns’ dwelling place, the third, is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:0.5.eng: 24. The training rule on worldly gain

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena therā bhikkhū bhikkhuniyo ovadantā lābhino honti cīvarapiṇḍapātasenāsanagilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhārānaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:1.2.eng: At that time the senior monks who were instructing the nuns received robe-cloth, almsfood, dwellings, and medicinal supplies.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:1.3.eng: And the monks from the group of six said this about them,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:1.4.pli: “na bahukatā therā bhikkhū bhikkhuniyo ovadituṃ; āmisahetu therā bhikkhū bhikkhuniyo ovadantī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:1.4.eng: “The senior monks aren’t instructing the nuns as a service, but for the sake of worldly gain.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:1.5.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:1.5.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:1.6.eng: “How can the monks from the group of six say that

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:1.7.pli: ‘na bahukatā therā bhikkhū bhikkhuniyo ovadituṃ; āmisahetu therā bhikkhū bhikkhuniyo ovadantī’”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:1.7.eng: the senior monks aren’t instructing the nuns to render a service, but for the sake of worldly gain?” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:1.8.eng: “Is it true, monks, that you say this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:1.9.pli: ‘na bahukatā therā bhikkhū bhikkhuniyo ovadituṃ; āmisahetu therā bhikkhū bhikkhuniyo ovadantī’”ti?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:1.12.pli: kathañhi nāma tumhe, moghapurisā, evaṃ vakkhatha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:1.12.eng: “Foolish men, how can you say this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:1.13.pli: ‘na bahukatā therā bhikkhū bhikkhuniyo ovadituṃ; āmisahetu therā bhikkhū bhikkhuniyo ovadantī’ti.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:1.15.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:1.15.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:1.16.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu evaṃ vadeyya—‘āmisahetu therā bhikkhū bhikkhuniyo ovandantī’ti, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:1.16.1.eng: ‘If a monk says that the senior monks are instructing the nuns for the sake of worldly gain, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:2.1.4.eng: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:2.1.5.eng: For the sake of worldly gain:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:2.1.6.pli: cīvarahetu piṇḍapātahetu senāsanahetu gilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhārahetu sakkārahetu garukārahetu mānanahetu vandanahetu pūjanahetu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:2.1.6.eng: for the sake of robe-cloth, for the sake of almsfood, for the sake of a dwelling, for the sake of medicinal supplies, for the sake of honor, for the sake of respect, for the sake of deference, for the sake of veneration, for the sake of worship.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:2.1.8.pli: upasampannaṃ saṅghena sammataṃ bhikkhunovādakaṃ avaṇṇaṃ kattukāmo ayasaṃ kattukāmo maṅkukattukāmo evaṃ vadeti— “cīvarahetu piṇḍapātahetu senāsanahetu gilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhārahetu sakkārahetu garukārahetu mānanahetu vandanahetu pūjanahetu ovadatī”ti bhaṇati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:2.1.8.eng: if, concerning one who is fully ordained and who has been appointed by the Sangha as an instructor of nuns—desiring to disparage him, desiring to give him a bad reputation, desiring to humiliate him—he says, “He instructs for the sake of robe-cloth,” “… for the sake of almsfood,” “… for the sake of a dwelling,” “… for the sake of medicinal supplies,” “… for the sake of honor,” “… for the sake of respect,” “… for the sake of deference,” “… for the sake of veneration,” “… for the sake of worship,” he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:2.2.1.pli: Dhammakamme dhammakammasaññī evaṃ vadeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:2.2.1.eng: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, and he perceives it as such, and he says such a thing, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:2.2.1.comm: The legal procedure in question is the one that gives approval to a monk to instruct the nuns. Sp 2.150: Adhammakammetiādīsu bhikkhunovādakasammutikammaṁ kammanti veditabbaṁ, “Adhammakamme: the legal procedure that gives approval to instruct the nuns should be understood.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:2.2.2.pli: Dhammakamme vematiko evaṃ vadeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:2.2.2.eng: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but he is unsure of it, and he says such a thing, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:2.2.3.pli: Dhammakamme adhammakammasaññī evaṃ vadeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:2.2.3.eng: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but he perceives it as illegitimate, and he says such a thing, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:2.2.4.pli: Upasampannaṃ saṅghena asammataṃ bhikkhunovādakaṃ avaṇṇaṃ kattukāmo ayasaṃ kattukāmo maṅkukattukāmo evaṃ vadeti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:2.2.4.eng: When someone who is fully ordained is an instructor of nuns, but he has not been appointed by the Sangha as such, and a monk—desiring to disparage him, desiring to give him a bad reputation, desiring to humiliate him—says,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:2.2.5.eng: “He instructs for the sake of robe-cloth,” “… for the sake of almsfood,” “… for the sake of a dwelling,” “… for the sake of medicines,” “… for the sake of honor,” “… for the sake of respect,” “… for the sake of deference,” “… for the sake of veneration,” “… for the sake of worship,” he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:2.2.6.pli: Anupasampannaṃ saṅghena sammataṃ vā asammataṃ vā bhikkhunovādakaṃ avaṇṇaṃ kattukāmo ayasaṃ kattukāmo maṅkukattukāmo evaṃ vadeti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:2.2.6.eng: When someone who is not fully ordained is an instructor of nuns, whether or not he has been appointed by the Sangha as such, and a monk—desiring to disparage him, desiring to give him a bad reputation, desiring to humiliate him—says,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:2.2.7.pli: “cīvarahetu piṇḍapātahetu senāsanahetu gilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhārahetu sakkārahetu garukārahetu mānanahetu vandanahetu pūjanahetu ovadatī”ti bhaṇati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:2.2.7.eng: “He instructs for the sake of robe-cloth,” “… for the sake of almsfood,” “… for the sake of a dwelling,” “… for the sake of medicinal supplies,” “… for the sake of honor,” “… for the sake of respect,” “… for the sake of deference,” “… for the sake of veneration,” “… for the sake of worship,” he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:2.2.8.eng: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but he perceives it as legitimate, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:2.2.9.eng: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:2.2.10.eng: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, and he perceives it as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:2.3.2.pli: pakatiyā cīvarahetu piṇḍapātahetu senāsanahetu gilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhārahetu sakkārahetu garukārahetu mānanahetu vandanahetu pūjanahetu ovadantaṃ bhaṇati,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:2.3.2.eng: if he says it to one who regularly gives the instruction for the sake of robe-cloth, … for the sake of almsfood, … for the sake of a dwelling, … for the sake of medicinal supplies, … for the sake of honor, … for the sake of respect, … for the sake of deference, … for the sake of veneration, … for the sake of worship;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:2.3.4.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:2.3.5.eng: The training rule on worldly gain, the fourth, is finished.
